page.title: 02FARMING IN PUTTENHAM
page.content:
The village has always been a farming community, but now most of the old farms and their buildings are converted into private houses.
Hampton Estates own the majority of the land (1130 hectares in all, including woodland.) They grow{wheat, which is made into bread and biscuits, and used for animal feed; {barley}for malting in beer and whisky, and also for animal feed;{oats}for porridge; {rye}for crispbread;{potatoes; hops which are used in brewing;{oil seed {rape}for margarine and oil;{peas}for canning and{grass}which is cut either for silage or hay. They also keep cattle both for{beef}and producing {milk.
